items.description: Sample ID. This should be a unique identifier for the sample within the dataset.
Subject ID. This should be a unique identifier for the subject from which the sample was derived.
Was derived from. This should be a unique identifier for the sample from which this sample was derived.
Pool ID. This should be a unique identifier for the pool to which this sample belongs.
Sample experimental group. This should be a unique identifier for the experimental group to which this sample belongs.
Sample type. This should be a unique identifier for the type of sample (e.g., blood, tissue, etc.).
Sample anatomical location. This should be a unique identifier for the anatomical location of the sample.
Also in dataset. This should be a unique identifier for any other datasets in which this sample is included.
Member of. This should be a unique identifier for any groups or cohorts to which this sample belongs.
Metadata only. Indicates whether this sample is metadata only (true) or not (false).
Laboratory internal id. This should be a unique identifier for the sample within the laboratory.
Date of derivation. This should be the date when the sample was derived.
Experimental log file path. This should be a valid file path to the experimental log file for this sample.
Reference atlas. This should be a unique identifier for the reference atlas used in the experiment.
Pathology. This should be a unique identifier for the pathology associated with this sample.
Laterality. This should be a unique identifier for the laterality of the sample (e.g., left, right, bilateral).
Cell type. This should be a unique identifier for the cell type of the sample.
Plane of section. This should be a unique identifier for the plane of section of the sample.
Protocol title. This should be a unique identifier for the protocol used in the experiment.
Protocol URL or DOI. This should be a valid URL or DOI to the protocol used in the experiment.
